FDG.function_description: Image editing or measurement tool interface

core_logic.logic: The image editing/measurement tool starts on page 0. The user can perform four actions: rotate the image (via a click), zoom out (click), zoom in (click), or adjust the zoom via a slider input. These actions are parallel options (no sequential flow between them), so the user chooses one action (rotate, zoom out, zoom in, or slider input) to modify the image/measurement view.

steps.summary: Click rotate icon to rotate the image/measurement frame
Click zoom out icon to decrease zoom
Click zoom in icon to increase zoom
Adjust zoom slider handle to set zoom level (e.g., 0.5)

FDG.function_description: This page is a side menu (hamburger menu) of an image editing or measurement tool app, providing options for scanning, accessing favorites/history, managing QR codes, adjusting settings, sharing, exploring other apps, and removing ads.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main image editing/measurement page. They click the hamburger menu icon, which opens the side menu containing options like Scan, Favorites, QR management, Settings, Share, Our Apps, and Remove ads. This is a single-step flow to access the menu's contents.

steps.summary: Click the hamburger menu icon to open the side menu

FDG.function_description: The current page is a system dialog for selecting an app (Photos or Gallery) to complete an image - related action (import/export) from the image editing or measurement tool, with options to set the app as default or use it just once.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the image editing/measurement page. The user clicks the image icon (for import/export), which triggers a system dialog to appear, offering options to complete the action using an app (like Photos or Gallery) with 'Just Once' or 'Always' settings, or to use a different app.

steps.summary: Click the image icon to initiate import/export, triggering the app selection dialog.

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as an image cropping or measurement interface, allowing users to adjust the crop area (via the blue corner handles), zoom in/out (via the zoom controls), and likely perform related image - editing or measurement - related actions on the displayed image.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 0 and clicks the crop or edit tool icon (action at [0,2]). This action likely initiates or adjusts the cropping/editing mode for the image, with the page remaining at 0 after the click.

steps.summary: Click the crop or edit tool icon

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a file selection interface to choose an image (via "Photos" or "Gallery") for scanning a QR code within the app.
data_out: app selection prompt for image scanning

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to input text (e.g., "Sample QR Text") in a text field to create a QR code, with a "Create" option to generate the QR code from the entered text.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'Favorites' menu option, which navigates to page 4. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops as there's only one action here.

steps.summary: Click the 'Favorites' menu option

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to input text (e.g., "Sample QR Text") to create a QR code, with a "Create" option to generate the QR code from the entered text.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'History' menu option, which navigates to page 4. This action is part of accessing a specific menu item within the app's navigation structure.

steps.summary: Click 'History' menu option

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to input contact information (full name, organization, address, phone, email, notes) to create a QR code for sharing their contact details, with the entered data used to generate the QR code for future access.
data_out: My QR contact info form loaded

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the 'My QR' menu option to access the contact info input page. Then, they input contact details (full name, organization, address, phone, email, notes) one by one. After entering all desired info, they click the save/checkmark button to generate and save the QR code for future access.

steps.summary: Click 'My QR' menu option to navigate to contact info input page
Input full name (John Doe) into the full name field
Input organization (Acme Corp) into the organization field
Input address (123 Main St) into the address field
Input phone (+1-555-123-4567) into the phone field
Input email (john@example.com) into the email field
Input notes (Team Lead) into the notes field
Click save/checkmark button to generate and save the QR code

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to create QR codes by selecting different types of content sources (e.g., clipboard, URL, text, contact, email, SMS, geo, phone, calendar, WiFi, or their own QR) to generate a corresponding QR code.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the initial page. The user clicks the 'Create QR' menu option, which navigates to the 'Create' page where various QR content source options (like clipboard, URL, text, etc.) are presented. No branches or loops are present in this initial flow as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click 'Create QR' menu option to navigate to the Create QR page

FDG.function_description: The current page is the settings interface for a QR code and scanning app, allowing users to configure options such as color scheme, theme, beep, vibrate, clipboard copying, URL info retrieval, batch scan mode, auto focus, and touch focus.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main menu page and clicks the 'Settings' option to navigate to the settings page. From there, the user clicks the 'Red color scheme selection button' to configure the color scheme setting.

steps.summary: Click 'Settings' menu option to open settings page
Click 'Red color scheme selection button' to set color scheme

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a sharing interface for the image editing or measurement tool, allowing users to share the content (likely an image or measurement result) via various apps and services such as Chrome, Gmail, QR & Barcode Scanner, Messages, Copy to clipboard, Drive, and Hangouts.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 1, where the user clicks the 'Share' menu option. This action navigates to page 8, which displays a sharing interface with various apps/services (Chrome, Gmail, etc.) for sharing the content. There are no branches or loops as only one action is provided, leading directly to the sharing options page.

steps.summary: Click the 'Share' menu option to open the sharing interface.

FDG.function_description: This page (likely part of the "Our Apps" section navigation) displays an offline status with options to retry connecting, get notified when online, and play a game (Hot Air Balloon) while waiting.
data_out: navigation to our apps page (offline state)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'Our Apps' menu option (from page 1 to page 9). On the resulting offline status page, the user can choose to retry connecting, get notified when online, or play the Hot Air Balloon game. The main flow is a straight line to the offline page, with subsequent actions (not yet listed) branching based on user choice.

steps.summary: Click 'Our Apps' menu option to navigate to the offline status page.

FDG.function_description: The current page (Google Play offline screen) allows the user to attempt re - connecting to the internet (via "Try again") or to request a notification when the device is back online (via "Notify me") while also providing navigation options for different Google Play content categories at the bottom.

core_logic.logic: On the Google Play offline screen, the user can choose to either click 'Try again' to attempt re - connecting to the internet or click 'Notify me' to request a notification when the device is back online. Additionally, there are navigation options for different Google Play content categories at the bottom of the screen.

steps.summary: Click 'Remove ads' menu option

FDG.function_description: The current page is a side menu (drawer) in a QR code and scanning app, providing options to navigate to different features like scanning, accessing favorites, viewing history, managing personal QR codes, creating QR codes, adjusting settings, sharing the app, exploring other apps by the developer, and removing ads, while also showing a QR scanning interface in the background.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on a page (page 4) with a hamburger menu button. The user clicks the hamburger menu button, which opens a side menu (drawer) displaying various navigation options (like Scan, Favorites, History, etc.) while a QR scanning interface remains visible in the background. This action transitions the app from the initial page (page 4) to the side menu - enabled state (page 1).

steps.summary: Click the hamburger menu button to open the side menu, with the QR scanning interface in the background.

FDG.function_description: The current page displays the QR code favorites list (which is empty) and provides options via the vertical ellipsis menu to delete favorites or export them in CSV or TXT formats.

core_logic.logic: On the QR code favorites page (which is empty), the user clicks the vertical ellipsis (more options) button. This action opens a menu with options to delete favorites or export them in CSV/TXT formats, allowing the user to choose a subsequent action (e.g., delete, export CSV, export TXT).

steps.summary: Click the vertical ellipsis (more options) button on the favorites page

FDG.function_description: The current page is a side menu of a QR code and scanning app, providing options to scan, scan images, access favorites, history, manage personal QR codes, create QR codes, adjust settings, share the app, view other apps by the developer, and remove ads.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 5 (Create QR page). This is a single step to open the menu, with no branches as it's a direct navigation action.

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to view, save, or share a generated QR code that encodes calendar event details (e.g., a team meeting), with options to save the QR code or share it, and displays the underlying calendar event data in text format.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 5 and clicks the Profile icon button (action_ref [5,8]) to navigate to page 12, where the calendar event QR code and its details are displayed. FDG.function_description: This page allows users to input WiFi network details (SSID, password, security type, and hidden network option) to create a QR code for sharing WiFi access.

Input text into QR code content field
Click checkmark button to confirm QR creation

FDG.function_description: Beep toggle checkbox

FDG.function_description: Batch scan mode toggle checkbox

FDG.function_description: This page enables the user to share the generated contact QR code through various apps (e.g., Gmail, QR & Barcode Scanner) after creating/editing the contact QR information.

FDG.function_description: All day event checkbox
